docs.snippet: The U.S. intelligence chief said on Wednesday that a decision had been made on the future of American troops in war-torn Syria and the White House would make it public soon.

headline.main: U.S. Makes Decision on Troops in Syria: Intelligence Chief
headline.print_headline: U.S. Makes Decision on Troops in Syria: Intelligence Chief

docs.snippet: Washington and Beijing are slapping each other with tit-for-tat tariff threats, with U.S. President Donald Trump proposing another escalation of the dispute late on Thursday.

headline.main: Key Events in Rapid Escalation of U.S.-China Trade Dispute
headline.print_headline: Key Events in Rapid Escalation of U.S.-China Trade Dispute

docs.snippet: Germany's foreign minister says his government will exert "considerable efforts" to protect the Iran nuclear deal despite Berlin's misgivings about Iran's ballistic missiles program and its involvement in the Syria conflict.

headline.main: German FM Vows 'Considerable Efforts' to Protect Iran Deal
headline.print_headline: German FM Vows 'Considerable Efforts' to Protect Iran Deal

docs.snippet: Iowa ethanol and biodiesel producers warned President Donald Trump on Friday that imposing restrictions on biofuels production "would be viewed as a declaration of war on rural America."

headline.main: Iowa Producers Say Ethanol Limits Would Be 'War' on Rural US
headline.print_headline: Iowa Producers Say Ethanol Limits Would Be 'War' on Rural US

docs.snippet: The Latest on President Donald Trump and Syria (all times local):

headline.main: The Latest: US Says Its Military Mission in Syria Nears End
headline.print_headline: The Latest: US Says Its Military Mission in Syria Nears End

docs.snippet: The White House's top infrastructure adviser is leaving the administration as President Donald Trump's plans to inject funding to repair the nation's roads and bridges will most likely have to wait until after the midterm elections.

headline.main: Top White House Infrastructure Aide Is Departing
headline.print_headline: Top White House Infrastructure Aide Is Departing

docs.snippet: China's Ministry of Commerce said it would take new comprehensive measures to safeguard the country's interests if the United States sticks to its protectionist behavior, after  President Donald Trump threatened an extra $100 billion in tariffs on...

headline.main: China Says Will Take New Measures if U.S. Sticks to Protectionist Trade Stance
headline.print_headline: China Says Will Take New Measures if U.S. Sticks to Protectionist Trade Stance

docs.snippet: U.S. Representative Nancy Pelosi, the top Democrat in the House of Representatives, on Friday called for Scott Pruitt to resign as head of the Environmental Protection Agency amid a growing scandal involving a condo he rented at well-below-market ...

headline.main: Pelosi Calls for EPA Chief Pruitt to Resign as Scandal Grows
headline.print_headline: Pelosi Calls for EPA Chief Pruitt to Resign as Scandal Grows

docs.snippet: Turkish Economy Minister Nihat Zeybekci has sent a letter to U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross seeking an exemption from new U.S. import tariffs on steel and aluminium, a Turkish official said.

headline.main: Turkey Sends Letter to U.S. Seeking Steel, Aluminium Tariffs Exemption-Turkish Official
headline.print_headline: Turkey Sends Letter to U.S. Seeking Steel, Aluminium Tariffs Exemption-Turkish Official

docs.snippet: The Latest on embattled Environmental Protection Agency Scott Pruitt and the ethical questions surrounding his travel and ties to Washington lobbyists (all times local):

headline.main: The Latest: Trump's Not OK With Recent News About Pruitt
headline.print_headline: The Latest: Trump's Not OK With Recent News About Pruitt
